can you start by telling us a little bit
about hey
so we're an australian owned but
globally run

and businesses with extraordinary
payment
experiences we have a team that is based
mainly in sydney and london
and we have two two businesses which we
launched with one
key tech philosophy so first we've got
our retail neo hay
which we've built for the australian

which meant there was a clear

and secondly we have
hass hay as a service which is uh the

other businesses to take advantage of

it's so great to see innovation in the

the benefits of being on the cloud for

uh so i think the key benefit for
consumers is that cloud
lowers the cost to entry um i think
there'd be a lot less
opportunity for fintechs if it wasn't
for the cloud and i think there'd be a
lot less disruption
and you know most of the services would
still be centered
around the bigger players the on-prem
cost would have been prohibitive for
what we've achieved
the other thing that i think is an
advantage is speed to market
even during a pandemic so we've
continued to innovate and deliver
through the period
uh very much enabled by aws and
during this period we released uh
australian first features
such as tiny big rewards which gives
people one percent back
uh on all purchases below 10 below 10
for the life of the product and we've
just launched as well our biodegradable
cart
a major concern for customers of banks
is often security
so how do you ensure the security of

so i think there's a strategic and a
technical answer to that question
the strategic answer is that used
correctly just using the cloud
improves or gives a boost to see your
security posture
one of the things we found throughout
our banking license journey is that the
regulator looks
very closely at any use of the cloud
and given that we wanted to be entirely
cloud native and run all of our
key workloads in the cloud uh this was
something we had to overcome
and we we finally found that they were
happy for us to be cloud-based as long
as we fully understood our risks
understood how to mitigate them and
understood everybody's responsibilities
under the shared responsibility model
i think you can't just expect to be safe
because
uh you're in the cloud and the hay team

for the various components of our

kms alongside our managed solutions such

rds etc we deployed a service mesh
in the kubernetes cluster that enforces
mutual tls
working with palo alto we have micro

and we perform reveal vulnerability
scanning
in the pipeline and in the live
containers at runtime
we do whatever we can to reduce the
service area for any attacks
and obviously we concentrate very
strongly on encryption at rest in
transit and all of those things
i mean obviously you know security is
very important and you do take it
seriously so that's great to hear

we believe that we should be in a place
